page.title: 15AGRICULTURE
page.content: An example of change in the countryside has been brought about by 'Pick Your Own'. Mr.W.H.Meredith owns Woodland Farm and uses approximately 3 hectares of his land for 'Pick Your Own'. He grows strawberries, raspberries, gooseberries,red and blackcurrants, broad beans and peas. He began this method of marketing 5 years ago, and has found it very successful for someone who only farms market garden crops on a small scale. The advantages are, that people come to him and pick their own - he does not have to employ casual labour to pick the crop, nor organise transport to market. The main disadvantage is the waste of the crop, through not being picked systematically, being eaten or being trodden into the ground. He also farms 30 hectares of cereals and sugar beet.
